subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Zipcar: The Founder Who Got Pushed Out
description: Learn Zipcar: The Founder Who Got Pushed Out in one minute.

hook.text: Robin Chase co-founded Zipcar and invented modern car-sharing. The board fired her two years later.

buildup.text: Chase built Zipcar from scratchâ€”sourcing cars, writing software, and recruiting the first 500 members.

discovery.text: The board decided a passionate founder wasn't the same as a CEO who could scale a company.

twist.text: Her replacement grew Zipcar to an IPO and a $500M acquisition by Avis. Chase got a fraction of the value.

climax.text: Chase watched the company she built become a billion-dollar brand without her name attached to it.

punchline.text: Building the rocket doesn't mean you get to fly it.

quiz.question: Why was Zipcar co-founder Robin Chase removed from her own company?
options: She committed financial fraud that the board discovered
The board believed a different leader was needed to scale the company beyond its startup phase
She voluntarily left to start a competing car-sharing service
